results.title: Veterans of the road
results.creator_credit: Esso Petroleum and Veteran Car Club of Great Britain
results.brief_description: Tells the lighthearted story of a Veteran Car Club Rally of vintage cars, held at Abingdon, in Berkshire. Of quaint appearance (none of a later vintage than 1916) and still lively performance, they are seen being submitted to tests of speed, braking and steering, to the delight of many onlookers.

results.title: Vauxhall: Bedford, England

results.title: Vasaloppet: the Vasa ski race = the Wasa ski race
results.brief_description: The Vasa Ski Race in Sweden is the biggest ski race in the world. The race which is held in memory of the King Gustav Vasa, who fled the Danes in 1530, is held every year on the first Sunday of March. Some ten thousand competitors enter this unusual and exciting cross-country ski race. Film includes re-creation of the 1530 event interspersed with shots of the race taken from the feature film ‘Gustav Vasa’.

results.title: Valleys and people
results.creator_credit: Douglas M. Robinson and Summit Film Productions
results.brief_description: A story of the accomplishments of Ontario’s Conservation authorities Branch, Department of Energy and Resources Management in Canada. Looks at how a conservation authority works and emphasises the need to retain the balance of nature.

results.title: Usutu
results.creator_credit: Stephen Peet, Raymond Spottiswoode, Courtaulds and Film Centre
results.brief_description: Describes a large afforestation project in Swaziland, which involved the planting of 50 million trees and the construction of a specially designed pulp mill. With the forest grew a new town, with schools, clinics and other social amenities.

results.title: Urban sprawl
results.brief_description: Shows the characteristic pattern of recent urban growth throughout the United States. Discusses the problems created by urban sprawl, explains the necessity for planning future development, and describes the factors that must be considered to make the best use of land space and to meet the total needs of people.

results.title: Urban Challenge
results.brief_description: Over-crowding and squalid living conditions have reached a crisis point in major cities in Third World Countries. This film examines the way in which governments and overseas aid agencies are meeting the challenge to improve living conditions for the cities’ poorer inhabitants.

results.title: Urashima Taro: a Japanese folk tale
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of a Japanese folk tale about Urashima Taro, who, after doing a good deed for a sea turtle, is transported to a kingdom beneath the sea. When he returns to land he discovers to his dismay that 3000 years have passed. An unusual story, highlighting the different cultural approach of the Japanese to story telling.

results.title: Up in smoke
results.creator_credit: Barbara Davies and British Columbia Forest Service
results.brief_description: Forest fire fighting in mountainous British Columbia has been developed to the precision of a military operation. Shows the whole pattern of attack, from the time smoke is sighted until the outbreak is brought under control. Includes aerial and ground attack.

results.title: Unzipped
results.creator_credit: Douglas Keeve, Michael Alden and Hachette Fillpacchi Productions
results.brief_description: Isaac Mizrahi is a talented New York fashion designer, who, after receiving negative reviews for his 1994 Spring collection, is in need of a successful season. This documentary tracks the evolution of Mizrahi’s next collection - from fledging moments of inspiration to final parade. “Unzipped” is a frank examination of the fashion industry at work - the superficiality, demands, personalities, exhaustion, frustrations, setbacks, camaraderie and creativity of it all. Supermodels take centre stage and the precociousness of this elite group is in evident abundance. Mizrahi seeks guidance from a diverse range of sources (including a ouija board) as he aims to evoke the look and style of an Inuit, mixed with 1950s cheesecake aesthetic, meets Mary Tyler Moore. Mizrahi’s mother is interviewed and gives insights into her son’s precocious talent, recognised and nurtured by her. Directed by Douglas Keeve, “Unzipped” is a candid examination of the sparks that fly when creative urges seek to ally financial interest. Features appearances from Naomi Campbell, Linda Evangelista, Cindy Crawford, Helena Christensen, Richard Gere, Eartha Kitt, Sandra Bernhard and Kate Moss. Winner of the Audience Award at the 1995 Sundance Film Festival.
